alert.note: Alert for McCulloch (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 21 at 6:28PM CDT until June 21 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Concho, McCulloch and Menard. * WHEN...Until 700 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 624 PM CDT, Radar indicated isolated light showers in Menard county. Between 1 and 1.75 inches of rain have fallen in extreme northeast Menard county and in extreme southwest Mcculloch county. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Brady, Calf Creek, Us-190 Near The Menard-Mcculloch County Line and The Intersection Of Us-190 And Ranch Road 1311. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... County Road 120 crossing East Cow Creek, County Road 128 crossing Reubes Creek, County Road 120 crossing Cow Creek, County Road 124 crossing Saddle Creek, Callan Lane crossing, Mahan crossing Taylor Branch and County Road 126 crossing Saddle Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
